entries.title: 'I had to flee Iran - if I stayed I would have been killed'
entries.description: Pershang Peighami arrived in England in an inflatable boat after a perilous journey from the Kurdish region of Iran.

entries.title: 'It's a kind of hell': The bitterly contested mining town where Putin hopes to secure his first victory in months
entries.description: The temperatures are well below freezing and spindles of snow swirl across the roads as gusts of icy wind cut like a million knives across the landscape.

entries.title: Riot police clear scores of anti-coal activists from abandoned German village
entries.description: German riot police have cleared scores of environmental activists from buildings in an abandoned village, on a second day of clashes over the expansion of a coal mine.

entries.title: Germany coal mine furore symbolises Europe's energy troubles
entries.description: Germany's Garzweiler mine could hardly be more symbolic of the conundrum facing much of Europe right now.

entries.title: Trump proposed using a nuclear weapon against North Korea and blaming it on another country, book claims
entries.description: Donald Trump proposed attacking North Korea with a nuclear weapon in meetings with aides and said that the US could blame the attack on another country, according to a book about his presidency.

entries.title: 'Fox in charge of henhouse': Activists criticise move to appoint UAE oil chief as chair of COP28
entries.description: Appointing the head of one of the United Arab Emirates' state-owned oil companies as the head of this year's UN climate conference "goes beyond putting the fox in charge of the hen house", according to a global charity.

entries.title: Romanian police raid seven more homes in Andrew Tate investigation
entries.description: Police in Romania have carried out raids on seven more homes as part of their investigation into social media influencer Andrew Tate.

entries.title: UFC president Dana White suggests he will not be punished for slapping wife at New Year's Eve party
entries.description: UFC president Dana White has suggested he will not face punishment after slapping his wife at a nightclub on New Year's Eve.

entries.title: University department removes word 'field' over racist 'connotations'
entries.description: A university department in the US has said it has removed the word "field" from its curriculum because it may have racist "connotations".

entries.title: Brownies' name changed to 'Embers' in Canada to stop 'girls experiencing racism'
entries.description: Brownies in Canada will be known as "Embers" from now on after the old name was deemed too racially divisive.

entries.title: COP28 climate talks to be led by UAE oil chief
entries.description: COP28 climate talks will be led by the man who heads up a state-run oil company in the United Arab Emirates, which pumps out four million barrels a day.

entries.title: Australia men's cricket team pulls out of Afghanistan matches over Taliban restrictions on women and girls' freedoms
entries.description: Australia men's cricket team has pulled out of matches against Afghanistan over the Taliban's restrictions on the freedoms of women and girls.
